Context: The George Brown College offers a variety of programs in hospitality management and culinary arts, including 21 certificate, diploma, degree, and postgraduate programs. New this year are the four-year Honours Bachelor of Food Studies Degree and the first four-year Culinary Management Honours Bachelor Degree. The college is located in downtown Toronto, near top restaurants, bars, hotels, and event venues. Students will be trained by industry professionals and gain real-world experience at The Chefs' House restaurant. Open House Discovery Days take place at 300 Adelaide St. East and can be registered for online. The Centre for Hospitality and Culinary Arts Ambassador Program is a volunteer program for students to connect with industry professionals and classmates at events. For more information, contact ask.george@georgebrown.ca or visit the social media hub. Phone number: 416-415-2000, TTY: 1-877-515-5559. Application deadlines, college news, upcoming events, tours, and other information can be signed up for on the website. Program offerings are subject to change without notice.
